description:
But first Rwanda has described as an "outrage", the arrest of its intelligence chief in London in connection with a war crime's investigation launched by Spain. Karenzi Karake, who's accused of involvement in reprisal killings after the Rwandan genocide of 1994, is due to appear in court later this week. Britain said it had a legal obligation to detain Mr Karake. The Spanish case was open in 2008, but analysts say there are concerns about the evidence in the indictment. Up to 800,000 people, mainly Tutsis, were killed by Hutu extremists in the Rwandan genocide. The Rwandan high commissioner to the UK is Williams Nkurunziza.

"All of us are very surprised. We could see that the arrest in our view as a travesty of justice. We take strong exception to the suggestion that he's been arrested on war crimes. These are indefensible charges that we are aware have been on the books since 2008, moved by politically motivated charges."
